meanings.definition: A person who is lazy and messy.
meanings.sent1: My brother is such a slob, leaving his clothes all over the floor.
meanings.sent2: The slob at work never cleans up after himself in the break room.
meanings.sent3: The slob in the movie always made everyone laugh with his messy antics.
meanings.sent4: She lived like a slob in a tornado-stricken house, chaos everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The slob's room looked like a tornado had hit it, with clothes strewn everywhere.

meanings.definition: To behave in a lazy and messy way.
meanings.sent1: I tend to slob around on weekends, just lounging on the couch.
meanings.sent2: Don't slob off your responsibilities; get up and do your chores.
meanings.sent3: He decided to slob through the day, not bothering to tidy up anything.
meanings.sent4: The students slobbed through the group project, resulting in a messy presentation.
meanings.sent5: She slobbed her way through the cleaning, leaving everything in disarray.
